page.name: Designing Literacy Content
page.content:
Educators can apply the principles of Universal Design for Learning (UDL) by ensuring literacy content  is:

  • Meaningful — Content can be made meaningful by connecting it to previous knowledge. Is this something the adult learner already knows about, or how can I connect it to their lives? Is this content about someone who lived in their neighborhood, for instance. 
  • Relevant — Content becomes relevant when it is useful and applicable. Does this content help the adult learner get a job or connect them with others. Can they use the information? 
  • Flexible — Making content flexible means providing choice. For example, the educator might ask the learner to share a news story, but could you give them a choice about what kind of story or where the story comes from?
